isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the 3rd-4th speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft front ( Figure 179).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Remove 3rd-4th Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft Front

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the groove at the mainshaft rear ( Figure 180).

figure.caption: Figure 179. Remove Snap Ring From Mainshaft Rear Groove

step1.para: Remove the reverse gear and spacer from the mainshaft rear ( Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 180. Remove Reverse Gear and Spacer

step1.para: From the mainshaft rear, pull the key from the mainshaft keyway ( Figure 182).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Pull Key From Mainshaft Keyway

note.para: When removing limit washers, spacers and gears, note their location on the mainshaft to facilitate reassembly. Keep the internal-splined washers and external-splined spacers with the gear from which they were removed. There is ONLY one limit washer and one spacer belonging to each gear.

step1.para: Turn the reverse gear limit washer to align its splines with those of the mainshaft and remove washer ( Figure 183).

figure.caption: Figure 182. Turn Reverse Gear Limit Washer to Align Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Remove the LO-Reverse speed sliding clutch from the mainshaft ( Figure 184).

figure.caption: Figure 183. Remove LO-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft

step1.para: Using a small screwdriver, turn the limit washer in the hub of LO speed gear to align its splines with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 185).

figure.caption: Figure 184. Turn Limit Washer to Align Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Pull the LO speed gear from the rear of the mainshaft to remove the limit washer, spacer, and gear ( Figure 186). If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the gear ( inset, Figure 186).

figure.caption: Figure 185. Pull LO Speed Gear From Rear of Mainshaft, and Remove Snap Ring

step1.para: Remove each remaining gear, limit washer, spacer, and sliding clutch from the mainshaft in the same manner previously detailed ( Figure 187). And, if necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of each gear.

figure.caption: Figure 186. Remove Each Remaining Gear, Limit Washer, Spacer and Sliding Clutch From Mainshaft
